input.query: US political party affiliation distribution 2024 Gallup Pew party identification

content.title: GOP Holds Edge in Party Affiliation for Third Straight Year
Party Affiliation Fact Sheet (NPORS) | Pew Research Center
Party Affiliation | Gallup Historical Trends

grounding.source: Pew Research Center NCHS classification (2018/2024); Census 2020 Urban Areas
grounding.note: Urban core ~31%, suburban/small metro ~55%, rural ~14% per Pew NCHS framework. Modifiers will shift these based on state population density.

grounding.source: U.S. Census Bureau CPS 2022/2023; educationdata.org compilation
grounding.note: 9% less than HS, 28% HS diploma, ~15% some college no degree, ~10% Associate's, ~23% Bachelor's, ~14% Graduate. Age modifier will suppress higher degrees for younger/older cohorts. For 18-24 year olds...[truncated]

constraints.reason: Plausible upper bound for household income in simulation

grounding.source: U.S. Census Bureau ASEC 2023/2024; Census.gov education-and-income story 2025
grounding.note: Median HH income: <HS ~$35K, HS ~$47K, Some College ~$55K, Associate's ~$62K, Bachelor's+ ~$95-132K. Lognormal reflects right-skewed income distribution. State modifiers will adjust for cost-of-living...[truncated]

grounding.source: U.S. Census Bureau ACS 2022; CDC NCHS Marital Status data
grounding.note: ~48% married, ~31% never married (single), ~11% divorced, ~6% widowed, ~4% domestic partnership. Age modifiers are critical: widowed nearly zero under 40; single much higher under 30.

distribution.mean_formula: 1.5 if marital_status == 'Single' else (3.1 if marital_status == 'Married' else (1.8 if marital_status == 'Divorced' else (1.5 if marital_status == 'Widowed' else 2.4)))

constraints.reason: Household must have at least 1 person (the respondent)
Upper plausible bound for household size

grounding.source: U.S. Census Bureau ACS 2022; average U.S. household size 2.53
grounding.note: National average HH size is 2.53. Married households average ~3.1; single/divorced/widowed average 1.5-1.8. Mean formula conditions on marital_status. Age also matters (empty nesters).

constraints.reason: If children present, household_size must be at least 2

grounding.source: U.S. Census Bureau CPS 2023; ~30% of households with adults have children under 18
grounding.note: About 30% of U.S. adult households have children under 18. Strong age dependency: peaks 30-44 age range (~45-50%), near zero for ages 65+. Single/widowed adults less likely than married.

grounding.source: BLS Labor Force Statistics 2023; U.S. Census Bureau ACS 2022
grounding.note: ~48% full-time, ~11% part-time, ~9% self-employed, ~4% unemployed, ~20% retired, ~8% student. Age modifiers critical: students peak 18-24, retired peak 65+. Education modifiers adjust unemployment.

grounding.source: BLS Occupational Employment Statistics 2023; Census ACS occupational classifications
grounding.note: BLS 2023: Management/Professional ~38%, Service ~17%, Sales/Office ~20%, Construction ~9%, Production/Transport ~10%, Other ~6%. Education modifiers strongly shift toward Management/Professional for B...[truncated]

grounding.source: Gallup 2024 party ID data; Pew Research NPORS 2024
grounding.note: Gallup 2024: 28% Dem, 28% Rep, 43% Independent. With leaners: ~45% Dem-leaning, ~46% Rep-leaning. Mapped to 5-point scale: ~17% Strong Dem, ~17% Lean Dem, ~22% Independent, ~17% Lean Rep, ~17% Strong ...[truncated]

grounding.source: Gallup 2023/2025 ideology data; 36% conservative, 36% moderate, 25% liberal nationally
grounding.note: Gallup 2023: 36% conservative, 36% moderate, 25% liberal. Decomposed to 5-point scale. Political_affiliation modifier will be the primary driver.

grounding.source: Pew Research Center Religious Landscape Study 2023/2024
grounding.note: ~24% Evangelical Protestant, ~13% Mainline Protestant, ~21% Catholic, ~6% Other Christian, ~2% Jewish, ~1% Muslim, ~3% Other non-Christian, ~30% None/Unaffiliated. Race/ethnicity modifiers important (...[truncated]

grounding.source: Pew Research Center Religious Landscape Study 2023; Gallup church attendance data
grounding.note: ~27% never attend, ~16% seldom, ~14% a few times/year, ~9% monthly, ~22% weekly, ~12% more than weekly. Religious_affiliation modifier will be primary driver; None/Unaffiliated will push heavily to Ne...[truncated]

grounding.source: Pew Research Center News Consumption surveys 2023/2024; Reuters Institute Digital News Report 2023
grounding.note: TV ~28%, Online/Digital ~27%, Social Media ~22%, Radio ~7%, Print ~5%, None ~11%. Age strongly modifies: older adults prefer TV, younger adults prefer social media/digital. Education also shifts towar...[truncated]

grounding.source: Pew Research Center News Media Attitudes 2023; AllSides Media Bias data
grounding.note: Roughly evenly distributed across categories as base, with political_affiliation and primary_news_source being primary modifiers. Democrats disproportionately consume left-leaning outlets; Republicans...[truncated]

grounding.source: Pew Research Center Social Media Use 2023/2024
grounding.note: Facebook ~68% of adults use; YouTube ~83%; Instagram ~47%; TikTok ~33%; X ~22%. Weighted by primary platform. Age modifies heavily: TikTok/Instagram dominant under 30; Facebook dominant 50+. None/Mini...[truncated]

distribution.mean_formula: 3.0 if social_media_platforms == 'TikTok' else (2.5 if social_media_platforms in ['Instagram', 'Twitter/X'] else (2.0 if social_media_platforms in ['Facebook', 'YouTube'] else 0.3))

constraints.reason: Cannot have negative social media hours
Upper plausible daily limit (leaving 8h for sleep)

grounding.source: Pew Research Center 2023; DataReportal Global Social Media Statistics 2023; avg US ~2.5h/day
grounding.note: US adults average ~2-2.5 hours/day on social media. TikTok users average higher (~3h). Lognormal captures right skew. Age modifier will reduce hours for older adults. None/Minimal users coded near zer...[truncated]

grounding.source: FCC Broadband Deployment Reports 2023; Pew Research Center 2024 internet access data
grounding.note: ~77% of US adults have home broadband; ~15% rely on mobile only; ~7% dial-up or satellite (rural); ~8% no internet. Urban/rural and income modifiers are primary drivers.

grounding.source: U.S. Census Bureau CPS Voting and Registration Supplement 2022; ~63% of eligible voters voted in 2020
grounding.note: ~43% vote in most elections; ~22% vote sometimes; ~25% rarely/never; ~10% actively volunteer/campaign. Age and education are strong positive predictors of voting. Younger adults have lower turnout.

grounding.source: U.S. Census Bureau Housing Vacancies and Homeownership (CPS/HVS) Q3 2023: national homeownership rate 65.9%
grounding.note: US homeownership rate ~65-66%. Income and age are primary modifiers: under-35 ownership ~38%, 65+ ~79%. Renters concentrated in urban areas and lower income brackets.

grounding.source: U.S. Census Bureau Health Insurance Coverage 2023; KFF Health Insurance Coverage data
grounding.note: ~49% employer-sponsored, ~20% Medicaid/CHIP, ~15% Medicare, ~6% Individual/ACA marketplace, ~3% Military/VA, ~7% uninsured (~8% uninsured rate 2023). Employment_status and income are primary modifiers...[truncated]

grounding.source: U.S. Census Bureau ACS 2022; foreign-born population ~13.9% of US population
grounding.note: ~86% US-born citizen, ~7% naturalized citizen, ~5% LPR, ~2-3% other visa/status. Race/ethnicity is the primary modifier: Hispanic and Asian adults have much higher foreign-born shares.

constraints.reason: Union members must be employed; retired/unemployed/student cannot be active union members

grounding.source: BLS Union Members Summary 2023: union membership rate 10.0% of wage/salary workers
grounding.note: BLS 2023 union membership rate is exactly 10.0% of wage and salary workers. Occupation modifier critical: public sector ~33%, private sector ~6%. Employment_status must be employed.

grounding.source: Gallup 2023/Pew Research 2023: ~32% of US adults personally own a gun; ~44% live in gun-owning household
grounding.note: Personal gun ownership ~32%; household gun ownership ~44%. Rural households ~46% own guns vs. urban ~19%. State and urban_rural modifiers are primary drivers.

grounding.source: Gallup confidence in institutions 2023; Edelman Trust Barometer 2023/2024
grounding.note: US institutional trust has declined substantially. Beta(2.5, 3.5) gives mean ~0.42 with slight left skew, reflecting low baseline trust. Political ideology and education are primary modifiers.

grounding.source: Cacioppo & Petty NFC research; meta-analyses linking NFC to education (r~0.3)
grounding.note: Beta(3,3) gives symmetric distribution centered at 0.5, reflecting roughly normal distribution of NFC in the general population. Education modifier will shift higher-educated individuals upward on thi...[truncated]

grounding.source: Pennycook & Rand 2019 (Cognition); Roozenbeek et al. 2020 misinformation susceptibility research
grounding.note: Base distribution slightly left-skewed (most people have moderate-to-low susceptibility). need_for_cognition and social_media_hours_per_day are primary modifiers (inverse NFC, positive social media ho...[truncated]
